i'm confused by this "noefi" option. it's widely recommended in various forums for efi booting, and yet supposedly disables efi runtime service access. i'm not sure why that would be a good idea or not

There are times when it's better to try to access things directly than try to use the EFI runtime services. The largest example is that you simply can't use the runtime services from 64 bit EFI with a 32 bit kernel.
